text: Two papers accepted for oral presentation at the International Conference on Autonomous Agents and Multiagent Systems (AAMAS). Congratulations Sanket and Meet.
Paper published in IEEE Transactions on Machine Learning in Communications and Networking.
Aaron Fanganello joined the MPALA Lab as a graduate researcher.
Audrey Smith joined the MPALA Lab.
Invited talk given at the University of Colorado Boulder on resilient multi-agent control.
Travis Porter joined the MPALA Lab.
Dave Fobar joined the MPALA Lab.
Matthew Smith joined the MPALA Lab.
Invited talk presented at the Workshop on Data-Driven and Risk-Aware Control for Safety-Critical Autonomous Systems (ACC).
Invited lecture delivered to the NSF RET cohort at Colorado School of Mines.
Daniel Kim and Ethan Brown joined the MPALA Lab.
Started serving as Associate Editor for IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters (RAL).
Meet Gandhi joined the MPALA Lab.
Paper accepted for oral presentation at the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Conference (EMBC). Congratulations Mykola.
Poster presented at the Colorado School of Mines Undergraduate Research Symposium.
New experimental swarm robotics testbed deployed using Crazyflie drones and OptiTrack motion capture.
Research project launched on resilient consensus under adversarial network conditions.
MPALA Lab hosted an internal workshop on distributed control and estimation.
Grant awarded supporting research in multi-agent autonomy and learning.
New multi-robot simulation infrastructure integrated with ROS 2.
